text: 750ml bottle pours out golden topped with a small head. Nose is funky cheese barrels citrus lemon zest. Taste is more of the nice funky notes oak barrel a citrus tartness and the cheese notes.

Bottle at Dangerous bottleshares 20th edition. Bottle thanks to Aaron or Bursprak. Pours hazy yellow with a tiny white head. Aroma of cheese, leather, lemon zest, funk and gooseberries. The taste is very tart with vinegar, funk, leather and cheese. Really good and complex beer.
Bottle thanks to Bursprak! Pours hazy yellow with a medium white head. Aromas of lactose, funk, citrus, lemon, green, tart apples. Taste is mouth dryingly sour, lactic, citrussy, lemony, funky.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours hazy blond with low white head. Minimal lacing. Aroma is of fruits, funk, apricots. Taste is of acidity, sourness, apricots. Palate: Medium body, medium carbonation. Overall: Real guenine gueuze features, wich is pretty rare in US. I would like to see (and probably even drink) more beers like this one from De Garde.

Pours a hazy golden with no head and no lacing. Nose is of cheese, light oak and wine. Taste is tart and winey as well, oaky. White wine. Not quite a gueuze but still really enjoyable for what it is. Body is light to medium, carbonation moderate and I found it to be a little too puckering. A pretty good De Garde and a nice blended american sour.

pours cloudy light golden with a small white head offering some retention and lacing. sharp lemons, tart apricots, woody, lots of old grassy hops, some funk in there - medium acidity; herbs. moderate carbonation, light body - oily; dry and assertively tart lemony-herbal finish. surprisingly gueuze-y but oh-so-sharp-and-thrat-cutting lemons. still quite enjoyed!

Robe jaunâtre trouble avec une petit cerne de mousse. Arômes dacide acétique, jus de citron, notes de bois mouillé, pomme verte. En bouche, saveurs très acides (mélange acétique et citrique), levures sauvages, pommes. Finale un peu épicée, belle présence du bois. Texture huileuse et corps mince à moyen. Très "gueuzy". Très bien.

Bottle (750 ml) shared at tasting. Hazy golden with a small white head leaving some lacing. Aroma isnt bad at all with nice funk, cheesy notes, lemon, green apples, hay, tropical fruits, mild oak spiciness and lactic notes. Taste is quite tart but never as acetic as their Berliner, fun funk, nice cheesy presence, a bit of yogurt, loads of lemon tartness, tropical fruits, stonefruits and mild oak spiciness. Medium body. Moderate to medium carbonation. Lemony and quite tart finish with lots of cheesiness. The profile is similar to Timmermans Oude Gueuze.

Bottle shared. Clear pale gold pour with thin foamy white head. Aroma is really nice, light acetic notes, sharp citrusy aromas, light lactic notes, good funk. Taste is tart, not overly acidic, nice citrusy acidity, lime juice. Palate is light bodied with med carbonation. Good stuff.

Bottle at Dangerous bottleshares 20th edition!! Featuring Zakoon and Aaron. Cloudy light golden pour with a small head. Notes of citrus, stone fruits, wheat, funk, crisp apple skin and some tartness. Really smooth and good!

Bottle at Dangerous bottleshares 20th edition!! Featuring Zakoon and Aaron. This one thanks to Aaron. Pours a hazy yellow with a small, white head. Aroma has grapes, oak, vinegar, vanilla, green apples, stone fruit, lots of funk, light sulfur. Taste is very sour, juicy fruity, dry funk, lots of oak. Very sour, but still within the frame of being drinkable. High carb and light, acidic body.

bottle shared by a friend, there it is... my 3000th ratebeer rating. bottle, poured a nice golden colour slight hazy with a nice small white ring on top. well lambic expired beer, wondering what we can get from them. aroma, big i mean BIG funk! old dusty hay, fresh pressed lemons, getting some sweet fruits, mango, tropical aswell. some cheese in there aswell, wet wood, amazing nose! taste is incredible bright, citrus, mango, fruity, funk, its incredible complex, little bit dry, dust, just amazing! lambic inspired beer, this is the closest it can get to a lambic. its the best sour beer ive had from the states (i did not have had the broken truck) this is just amazing! i would love to drink this the entire day. this was the best way to celebrate my 3000th rating. on to the next 3.

2-3 Bottles. Pours cloudy orange tinted golden with a small white head that dissipates quickly. Nose is horseblanket, leather, lemon, coconut, tangerines, peach, and apricots. Sharp flavor with lots of acidity up front; notes of stone fruits are heavy along with a pronounced barnyard funk. Finishes acidic and dry. This is on point with some of the best American gueuze interpretations I have had.
Bottle..Pour is golden with a white head..Nose is musty, funk, old hops, spice, oak, yogurt. ..Taste is funk, oak, cheese, old hops, tartness, oak...

Bottle with thanks to Nolen! Pours cloudy, small white head, dissipates quickly, good lacing. Aroma is funk, cheezy, horse blanket, oak, sweat socks. Holy gueuze batman. Flavor is dry, medium plus funk, light tart, oaky, lots of gueuziness, hints of citrus fruit. Medium body.
Bottle shared with bytemesis group. Opaque yellow color. Fruity with lots of barnyard. Tart, tingly, peach, very clean aftertaste. Simple and superior.

Poured from a bottle courtesy of Snuffy. 
Aroma is slightly poopy, but it blows off. Nice tropical fruit notes with some lighter stone fruit character. Light oak notes with some citrus notes as well. Faint musty notes. Some light peppery phenolics.
Pours a hazy, pale golden hay color with a small, white head that quickly disappears. No lacing and small legs. 
Flavor is moderately acidic with some nice lemon and pineapple notes. Light stone fruit character and a bit of oak. No poop character. Very faint mustiness. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a pretty decent sour. Similar to DDG but acidity is a bit sharper and it has some de Garde funk.

Crisp clear straw yellow pour with white micro bubbled head that leaves a thin ring. Smells like a golden sour. White wine, tannins, de grade yeasty tones, barrel character with a floral chemical tone. Fruity ending. Light medium body with a subtle tartness like a mellow lemon. Nice balancing act between sweet and sour and yeasty. Taste is citrusy fresh dominated by sweet lemony tones, de grade funk, and dried grasses. Floral and honey tones roll around with a bright white wine tone and barrel characteristics. Really good golden sour from de garde. Their best I've had yet.

Tasting at MattsCloudy blond color with small head. Fantastic aroma, Lambic, wet cellar, cobwebs, some lemon peel, light hazelnut, light foot, light fuel. Very sour, lemony, but also somehow smooth, plenty of lemon peel, and a lot of cellar character.Excellent.
Bottle - Lots of wild funk, along the line so 3F OG. Cloudy gold with a nice white head. Nice grape, melon, acidic and funk. Fruity, funky, nice.

750mL bottle, pours a cloudy golden with a small white head. Nose is amazingly funky, with loads of barnyard funk, peach, tart fruit and oak. Flavour matches accordingly, with notes of barnyard funk, lightly tart peaches and oak. Very low acidity, but very high funk and slight vinegar. Really wonderful blend here. Excellent.
bottle from Shads tasting, incredible complexity and nuances, lightly sour and lightly grainy, a little wheaty too

500th sour rating. Bottle thanks to Russell. Pours a cloudy yellow with small white head that lasts. The aroma is hay, oak, funk. Thin mouth, strong lemon, oak, funk, very sour, really enjoyed this. Congrats to Trevor and Linsey!
Bottle. Pours gold white head. Nose/taste of oak, sour funk, white wine, gin, sour lemon and light cheese - Lighter medium body.
